concept_data.title: principle of the freedom of the seas

summary: The "principle of the freedom of the seas" is a foundational concept in international law, emphasizing the unrestricted use of the world's oceans for navigation, fishing, and resource exploitation. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, this principle underpins various maritime policies and agreements, promoting sustainable development and environmental protection. The EU actively engages in international negotiations to uphold the freedom of the seas, ensuring that member states adhere to these norms. As a redirect, this concept is synonymous with the preferred term "freedom of the seas," which encapsulates the rights and responsibilities associated with maritime governance within EU law.
